title: Darken global background via CSS overlay

requirements.summary: Darken the site-wide background images on desktop and mobile/portrait by layering a dark gradient/overlay above the existing background images while preserving current fixed/cover/no-repeat behavior and keeping foreground + bubble decorations visible.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop sizes, the global background (currently set on the `html` element in `frontend/src/index.css`) is visibly darker than before while still showing the neon green lines/bubbles.
On mobile/portrait sizes (the existing `@media (max-width: 768px), (orientation: portrait)` rule), the mobile background is also visibly darker than before.
The background still uses cover, centered positioning, no-repeat, and fixed attachment as it did previously.
Foreground sections and the existing bubble overlay decorations remain visible and are not obscured by the darkening approach (i.e., darkening is applied only to the background rendering).

file_operations.description: Update the global `html` background CSS to render a darker background by stacking a dark overlay/gradient as the first `background-image` layer, followed by the existing image URL. Preserve existing behavior (cover, centered position, no-repeat, fixed attachment). Apply the same approach in the existing mobile/portrait media rule while keeping the image asset paths exactly as `/assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles.dim_1920x1080.png` and `/assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles-mobile.dim_1080x1920.png`.
